title: Unable to Sync
body:
**Describe the bug**
Yesterday the Node (Full) i cant seem to discover any peers. i have also updated to the latest version but still doesnt work. I left it looking for peers for more than 8 hours.

I ran another instance on another machine to test. i can sync with no issues.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. $ /usr/share/nethermind/Nethermind.Runner

**Expected behavior**
Connect to nodes and sync

**Screenshots**

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS

Most of the time on a popular network like mainnet this is caused by network configuration issue, can you check port 30305 is open and routed correctly, also if your host IP is correctly recognized? Your JSON RPC address 0.0.0.0 might signal its not. You can try set ExternalIP in network config: https://docs.nethermind.io/nethermind/ethereum-client/configuration/network

Otherwise @matilote @1swaraj can you advise?
@LukaszRozmej I have tried all that , the issue is still the same.

Enabled Trace for the node, below was the exceptions that were caught:

The exception that caught my eye mentions : : Cannot initialize eth66 without the head block set .

@ehabhussein have you been able to solve the issue?
I haven't . I have opted with a redeployment of the node from scratch ...

Ah sorry, didn't come to my mind that a debug_resetHead might have recovered the node.
Also added some recovery for this corruption for BlockTree, hard to find  a root cause other than debug_resetHead itself,

Hello @LukaszRozmej is there a tutorial how to use `debug_resetHead` ? I am using nethermind docker-images and I am getting

`execution-client | 2023-06-30 12:55:19.4128|Detected corrupted block tree data (28652008 < 28652009) (possibly due to an unexpected shutdown). Attempting to fix by moving head backwards.`

What can I add to the docker-compose file in order to start the syncing from an earler block head?

> Hello @LukaszRozmej is there a tutorial how to use `debug_resetHead` ? I am using nethermind docker-images and I am getting
> 
> `execution-client | 2023-06-30 12:55:19.4128|Detected corrupted block tree data (28652008 < 28652009) (possibly due to an unexpected shutdown). Attempting to fix by moving head backwards.`
> 
> What can I add to the docker-compose file in order to start the syncing from an earler block head?

Does it manage to recover? Is your node an archive node? (If not to both questions it is probably easier to resync)
